title: The Sunday Philosophy Club
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: They walked up Dundas Street, crossing Queen Street, and along towards  Thistle Street, where Isabel said they would find the restaurant. The town was not busy,  and there was no traffic in Thistle Street.

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: Withthe greatest difficulty suppressing a smile, I asked him whenthe apparition had appeared. " When I saw it, it was on the stair leading up to my housein Thistle Street," he answered. " It was a man much aboutthe same height and appearance as Lawrence, and he justwalked past me down the stair, looking at me like a ghost, andchamping his teeth as he went by."

title: The Sunday Philosophy Club
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: They walked up Dundas Street, crossing Queen Street, and along towards  Thistle Street, where Isabel said they would find the restaurant. The town was not busy,  and there was no traffic in Thistle Street. So they walked a short distance in the road itself, their footsteps echoing against the walls on either side.

title: Forging his chains.
author: Bidwell, George.
snippet: M'Kelvie then called a coal porter, who was in the vicinity, and with his assistance,  he conducted Bidwell to Pitt Street, where a cab was got. He was then conveyed to Messrs. Gibson-Craig, Dalziel & Brodie's office in Thistle Street, and information of the capture was sent to the police authorities.

title: Friends, Lovers, Chocolate
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Isabel had reserved a table near the front window of the Café St Honoré. From where they sat they could look up the short, steep section of cobbled road that led to Thistle Street. It  was  a small restaurant and  well suited for a

title: The Comfort of Saturdays
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: They went to the Café St Honoré, a small French restaurant off Thistle Street. It was a favourite of Isabel's; intimate, but not so intimate as to inflict upon one the conversations of those at neighbouring tables.

title: Solved Mysteries; or, Revelations of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: If a man kills another he is condemned andhanged as a reasonable being, but if he kills himself, as he hasa perfect right to do, he is labelled, ' temporarily insane.' When my beard had grown I one night ventured over toThistle Street, and hung about till I saw my sweet widow. She was one mass of crape from head to foot, and looked sobeautiful and pensive and poetic under her great sorrow thatif I had not known what was underneath I should have fallenin love with her myself.
